intro: Ectadium latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf ectadium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, often in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Ectadium latifolium plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
